meanings.sent1: The pencil had an apiculate end.
meanings.sent2: The apiculate leaves of the plant were sharp.
meanings.sent3: The apiculate hat made him look like a tiny wizard.
meanings.sent4: Her apiculate wit always cut through the nonsense.
meanings.sent5: The apiculate mountain peak pierced the sky.

meanings.definition: To have a small, pointed tip.
meanings.sent1: She carefully apiculated the pencil to make it sharp.
meanings.sent2: The tree branches apiculate towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: He apiculates his arguments to make them more convincing.
meanings.sent4: Her words apiculate like arrows hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The artist apiculated the details of the painting with precision.

meanings.sent1: The insect's apiculate was used to sting its prey.
meanings.sent2: The apiculate of the arrow was sharp and deadly.
meanings.sent3: She collected different types of apiculates for her collection.
meanings.sent4: The apiculate of the iceberg was just the tip of the massive structure.
meanings.sent5: The apiculate of the compass always pointed north.
